content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function `extract_julia_code` written in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    # Regular expression for finding code blocks
    re = r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```"s
    
    matches = collect(eachmatch(re, md))
    if length(matches) > 0
        codes = [match.captures[1] for match in matches]
        
        # Remove code fences
        cleaned_codes = map(strip_fences, codes)

        # Join the code blocks together with a newline
        return join(cleaned_codes, "\n\n")
    else
        return ""
    end
end

function strip_fences(code)
    # Remove fences from each side of the code block
    stripped = code[7:end-3]  # Assuming "```julia" is 7 chars and ``` is 3 chars on both ends
    
    return stripped
end
```
Please note that this function will only work correctly if there are no nested fenced blocks (code blocks within other code blocks). If there could be nested fences, you would need a more sophisticated approach to remove the outer fence while preserving the inner one.
